Name: AddressType

Name: AddressUse

Name: AdministrativeGender
Title: AdministrativeGender
Descriptino: The gender of a person used for administrative purposes.

Name: IdentifierUse
Title: IdentifierUse
Descriptino: Identifies the purpose for this identifier, if known .

Name: LinkType
Title: Link Type
Descriptino: The type of link between this Patient resource and other Patient/RelatedPerson resource(s).

Name: LOINC
Title: Logical Observation Identifiers
Descriptino: Names and Codes (LOINC)
Used: LOINC provides a set of universal names and ID codes for identifying laboratory and clinical test results.1,2 LOINC facilitates the exchange and pooling of results, such as blood hemoglobin, serum potassium, or vital signs, for clinical care, outcomes management, and research. LOINC's universal identifiers (names and codes) can be used in the context of order and observation exchanges between information systems that use syntax standards such as HL73, CEN TC251, ISO TC215, ASTM4, and DICOM. Specifically, the identifier can be used as the coded value for an observation in any other standard that uses the observation/observation value paradigm, whether messages, documents, application programming interface (API), etc. For example, LOINC codes are used widely in the OBX segment Observation Identifier field (OBX-3) of an ORU HL7 (HL7 version 2.x or ASTM 1238-9410) message that may be sent between a Clinical Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) and Electronic Health Record Systems (EHR).5, 6 In this way, LOINC codes provide universal identifiers that allow the exchange of clinical data between heterogeneous computing environments.

Name: ContactRole2
Title: contactRole2
Descriptino: Code system of concepts which specify a relationship role that the next of kin/associated parties plays with regard to the patient. Also used in referrals, for example, it may be necessary to identify the contact representative at the clinic that sent a referral. Used in HL7 Version 2 messaging in the NK1 and CTD segments after 2.5, when it replace 2.16.840.1.113883.18.57.

Name: IdentifierType
Title: identifierType
Descriptino: HL7-defined code system of concepts specifying type of identifier. Used in HL7 Version 2.x messaging data types CX, PLN, PPN, XCN and XON.

Name: ExpandedYesNoIndicator
Title: expandedYes-NoIndicator
Descriptino: HL7-defined code system of concepts used to specify an expansion on the original Yes/No indicator table by including "flavors of null".  It is intended to be applied to fields where the response is not limited to "yes" or "no".  Used in numerous locations in HL7 Version 2.x messaging.

Name: Ethnicity
Title: Ethnicity
Descriptino: **Deprecation Information:** Deprecated due to UP-265. This code system in NOT the acknowledged source of truth for Ethnicity concepts and codes. It should no longer be used. https://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem-CDCREC.html should be used in its place. In the United States, federal standards for classifying data on ethnicity determine the categories used by federal agencies and exert a strong influence on categorization by state and local agencies and private sector organizations. The federal standards do not conceptually define ethnicity, and they recognize the absence of an anthropological or scientific basis for ethnicity classification. Instead, the federal standards acknowledge that ethnicity is a social-political construct in which an individual's own identification with a particular ethnicity is preferred to observer identification. The standards specify two minimum ethnicity categories: Hispanic or Latino, and Not Hispanic or Latino. The standards define a Hispanic or Latino as a person of "Mexican, Puerto Rican, Cuban, South or Central America, or other Spanish culture or origin, regardless of race." The standards stipulate that ethnicity data need not be limited to the two minimum categories, but any expansion must be collapsible to those categories. In addition, the standards stipulate that an individual can be Hispanic or Latino or can be Not Hispanic or Latino, but cannot be both.

Name: MaritalStatus
Title: MaritalStatus

Name: NullFlavor
Title: NullFlavor
Descriptino: A collection of codes specifying why a valid value is not present.

Name: Race
Title: Race
Descriptino: **Deprecation Information:** Deprecated per UP-263. This code system is NOT the acknowledged source of truth for Race concepts and codes. It should no longer be used. https://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem-CDCREC.html should be used in its place. In the United States, federal standards for classifying data on race determine the categories used by federal agencies and exert a strong influence on categorization by state and local agencies and private sector organizations. The federal standards do not conceptually define race, and they recognize the absence of an anthropological or scientific basis for racial classification. Instead, the federal standards acknowledge that race is a social-political construct in which an individual's own identification with one more race categories is preferred to observer identification. The standards use a variety of features to define five minimum race categories. Among these features are descent from "the original peoples" of a specified region or nation. The minimum race categories are American Indian or Alaska Native, Asian, Black or African American, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, and White. The federal standards stipulate that race data need not be limited to the five minimum categories, but any expansion must be collapsible to those categories.

Name: CVDComorbiditiesCS
Title: Cardiovascular Comorbidities
Descriptino: CodeSystem that indicate which comorbidities the patient is living with. Select all conditions that apply.

Name: ConsciousnessCS
Title: State of Consciousness according to the ICHOM standard
Descriptino: CodeSystem based on the ICHOM standard that indicates the patient's state of consciousness as measured upon arrival at the reference hospital.

Name: DiagnosisCS
Title: Diagnostic Evidence Base
Descriptino: CodeSystem that indicates which diagnostic evidence base was used for its realization

Name: DischDestCS
Title: Discharge Location
Descriptino: CodeSystem about Discharge destination following acute care hospitalization. What type of place was the patient discharged to?

Name: EstStrokeSevNIHSSCatCS
Title: Estimated stroke severity using the NIHSS.
Descriptino: CodeSystem that intends to categorize the severity of the stroke based on the National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS).

Name: LiveAloneCS
Title: Live Alone Pre-Stroke
Descriptino: CodeSystem indicating whether a patient lived alone prior to a stroke event based on ICHOM terminology.

Name: LivingLocPostCS
Title: Patient's Residence Post to a Stroke
Descriptino: CodeSystem that represents the patient's most recent place of residence after the occurrence of a stroke based on ICHOM code.

Name: LivingLocPreCS
Title: Patient's Residence Prior to a Stroke
Descriptino: CodeSystem that represents the patient's most recent place of residence before the occurrence of a stroke based on ICHOM code.

Name: PROMIS10CS
Title: PROMIS-10 Response Questionnaire
Descriptino: CodeSystem that defines the response values for the PROMIS-10 (Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System 10-item short form) Questionnaire.

Name: SMRSqCS
Title: Simplified Modified Ranking Scale questionnaire (sMRSq)
Descriptino: CodeSystem that defines the response values for the simplified modified Ranking Scale questionnaire (sMRSq).

Name: SmokingStatusCS
Title: Smoking Status
Descriptino: CodeSystem for Smoking Status. A person's current and past smoking behavior.

Name: StrokeFuncStatusCS
Title: Prestroke and Poststroke Functional Status
Descriptino: CodeSystem that defines the response values for the Prestroke and Poststroke Functional Status.

Name: StrokeTypeCS
Title: Stroke Type
Descriptino: CodeSystem that aims to categorize the stroke type according to the ICHOM standard.

Name: SymtDurCS
Title: Duration of Stroke Symptoms
Descriptino: CodeSystem that categorizes the duration of stroke symptoms, considering the time from symptom onset to admission at the reference hospital.

Name: Ietf3066
Title: Tags for the Identification of Languages
Descriptino: Older value from OID registry.  Superceded; see recommendations in BCP-47.
